elements.text: PART ONE
OPENING THEME
SCENE 1. INT. NARROW SHAFT.
FX: NARROW CAVE, BARELY A METRE WIDE. DRIPPING WATER.
(CAST ARE SLIDING OVER SLIPPERY ROCK AND SQUEEZING THROUGH
GAPS. ALL VOICES HUSHED, TO AVOID SETTING OFF A ROCK-FALL. )
(LEADING THE GROUP) . Careful, Holly. One false move —
- could bring the whole lot down, yeah yeah.
It’s no joking matter. This tunnel is the only way in — or out.
(FROM UP AHEAD) Choke up ahead for five, ten metres.
After that?
(STRETCHES TO LOOK) Can’t see. Gonna be a tight squeeze.
FX: THEY STOP MOVING AT THIS POINT.
Map? Jannik?
Hold on. (FX: USES ELECTRONIC GADGET LIKE AN IPAD, IT CREATES A
MAP) If we are where I think we are —
(SARCASTIC LAUGH) If!
- we’re approaching the northern shaft. If it’s clear, that should give us access to the lower levels.
How sure are you?
As sure as I can be, given that the compass is playing silly- beggars.
#225a: VORTEX ICE by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 3
A bad workman (always) —
It’s not my fault. (FX: GADGET MAKES PHHHT! NOISE, SO HE BANGS IT. IT DEACTIVATES.) There must be magnetic interference.
Just not keen on us getting caught in another dead-end.
(MUTTERS) If you’d listened to me...
Look, shall I just go on ahead?
Not without my say-so. Alright, Holly, you clearly have something to say, so let’s hear it.
FX: WHITFIELD BRIEFLY SWITCHES ON A GEIGER COUNTER-ISH GADGET.
Just that the ion emission count has been increasing for the last half hour. We’re getting warmer.
(SARCASTIC) Well, we are two hundred metres below sea level.
You mean we’re heading the right way?
I mean, whatever we’re looking for is somewhere on the other Side of those rocks.
Assuming there’s a way through.
If there isn’t, that’s it, we’ll have to turn back.
We haven’t come this far to turn back. Okay. Dylan, on you go.
Right. (SQUEEZES THROUGH ROCKS)
Carefully. I want to be able to see you every step of the way.
#225a: VORTEX ICE by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 4
(MUTTERS TO HIMSELF) I’m always careful.
FX: SMALL ROCK FALL, MOSTLY PEBBLES.
SAI, HOLLY, JANNIK: (REACT, HOLDING BREATH)
FX: ROCK FALL STOPS.
(LAUGHS WITH RELIEF) If that’s careful, I’d hate to know what
you’re like when you’re clumsy.
Dylan?
(SQUEEZING) I’m fine. Just had a bit of a scare, that’s all.
Right. But take it slowly. This mine has enough ghosts in it without us joining them.
MUSIC LINK.
#225a: VORTEX ICE by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 5
SCENE 2. INT. MINE WORKING.
FX: WATER DRIPPING HERE. TARDIS LANDS. DOOR OPENS.
(EMERGES, FX: SWITCHES ON TORCH) A cave. No, these walls have been excavated. A mine!
(NOTE: FLIP IN THIS EPISODE KNOWS EVERYTHING THAT IS GOING TO HAPPEN IN ADVANCE BUT PRETENDS SHE DOESN’T TO AVOID MAKING THE
SUSPICIOUS. ALTHOUGH THE DOCTOR HAS ALSO BEEN THROUGH
THIS BEFORE HE HAS LOST HIS MEMORY OF HAVING DONE SO, SO HE IS ACTING COMPLETELY AS NORMAL. )
(EMERGES) We’re underground?
Going by the ambient pressure, seven hundred feet underground.
Ambient pressure? You took a reading from the TARDIS console before we left, I saw you.
(DEFENSIVE) I was merely ascertaining our location and date.
FX: HE LOCKS TARDIS.
I think it’s sweet that you still try to impress me. So where
is this mine, then?
Earth. Northern Mexico, Chihuahua.
Where the little dogs come from?
Where, as you say, the little dogs come from.
(EXHALES) No wonder it’s so hot.
The temperature is due to our depth, not our latitude.
What, cos we’re approaching the Earth’s core?
#225a: VORTEX ICE by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 6
. Not quite.
FX: THEY WALK ON, FLIP LEADING THE WAY.
No? (REACTING TO HEAT, WAFTING TOP) Like an oven, though. When- abouts are we? Past or future?
As far as you’re concerned, the present, give or take a few years.
So what are we doing here?
(SOMETHING AMISS?) You’re full of questions today, Flip.
(COVERING — SHE’S BEEN ASKING TOO MANY) Aren’t I normally? We didn’t arrive by accident, did we?
No, the TARDIS detected some exotic particles uncharacteristic of this planet.
Uncharacteristic? You mean they’re alien?
Extra-terrestrial. “Alien” is a relative term.
That explains that look in your eye.
What look?
That ‘I’ve found a mystery’ look. You love it!
I admit to taking a certain degree of satisfaction in the pursuit of knowledge -
FX: THE CAVE WALL CRUMBLES OPEN, SMALL ROCKS BEING DISLODGED.
(REACTS) Doctor — the wall! Someone’s coming out —
#225a: VORTEX ICE by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 7
Yes. It seems we have company.
(PICKING HIMSELF UP, SEEING THEM) Sacre bleu!
Ah. You have the quizzical look of a man who’s wondering what we're doing here.
You could say that.
(OFF) Dylan, what is it? Are you alright?
I’m fine. But you’ve gotta see this for yourself, cos you’re not gonna believe it.
FX: DYLAN HAULS SAI THROUGH.
(WHISPER TO FLIP) Flip. They don’t appear to be armed, but be careful.
Will do.
(EMERGING FROM GAP) So, what have you got for — oh my.
Hello!
Hiya!
How the hell did you get down here?
Were... um...
Tourists.
Yes. Tourists.
Sightseeing.
#225a: VORTEX ICE by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 8
Seeing the sights.
And we got lost.
Hopelessly misplaced ourselves.
And we fell down a hole.
Whoops-a-daisy!
Then we got lost again.
No sense of direction.
And ended up here. True story.
FX: JANNIK CLAMBERS IN.
(EMERGING FROM HOLE) What’s going on? (BEAT) Who are they?!
How many more of you are in there?
Answer the question. Who are you?
I’m the Doctor, this is my friend Philippa Jackson —
But you can call me Flip.
And we’re clearly no threat. Your turn. Why are you here?
We are here as part of a classified speleological research group.
Classified speleological research?
#225a: VORTEX ICE by Jonathan Morris
Doctor, what’s speel -
The study of caves.
Oh, right, yeah.
FX: HOLLY SQUEEZES OUT OF GAP.
Who are you talking to — oh!
(FINAL) Page 9
This is Holly Whitfield, physicist. The belligerent Frenchman
is Dylan Argent, expert caver, exobiologist.
An exobiologist? Interesting.
And I am Professor Sai Chopra,
Professor, I think we might be beneficial arrangement.
What?
Pool our resources. After all,
thing - alien life!
MUSIC LINK.
and the German is Jannik Woolf,
leader of this expedition.
able to come to a mutually
we're both looking for the same
#225a: VORTEX ICE by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 10
SCENE 3a. INT. MINE WORKING.
FX: JANNIK IS PASSING AROUND FLASK, UNWRAPPING NUTRI-BARS.
You’re not letting them come with us, Professor?
I don’t see that I have any choice, Jannik. (DRINKS)
But we don’t know anything about them.
So where would you rather have them? Where we can see them - or between us and the way out? If they caused a rockfall -
I take your point.
(BITES BAR) One of us could go back with them.
And who would you nominate, Dylan? We’re all essential to the mission.
Alright, they can come with us. But I don’t trust them.
DRINKS
I’m not asking you to trust them. I’m asking you to keep an eye
on them.
#225a: VORTEX ICE by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 11
SCENE 3b. INT. MINE WORKING. [CONTINUOUS]
FX: MOVE TO OTHER GROUP, A LITTLE WAY AWAY. DOCTOR ACTIVATES A
CHIRRUPING, BLEEPING GIZMO.
What’s that?
A more sophisticated version of your own detector... Yes. The source of the exotic particles is almost directly beneath us.
FX: GIZMO OFF.
So it’s just a question of getting down there.
What do you think it is, the source?
Impossible to say. Unless your friend has any ideas?
Me? No, I’m as in the dark as you are. Quite literally. Tell me, what led you to this mine?
A satellite scanning for neutrinos picked up an energy spike, like nothing anybody had ever seen before.
So this source isn’t a new development?
No. It could have been there forever. But obviously it might have some connection to the disaster.
What disaster?
A hundred years ago there was an explosion. Only twenty miners made it out alive, the ones working on the upper levels. The rest were crushed, or trapped. Their bodies were never recovered.
How many were there?
Over a hundred. But you must know this!
#225a: VORTEX ICE by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 12
I’m afraid we skimped on our research. So you’ve opened up the mine?
We blasted our way into the upper level, and we’ve been working our way down ever since.
How long have you been down here?
(JOINING THEM) Two days.
Woah.
Why, how long have you been down here?
Oh, about the same, two days, yeah, the same.
I see. Well, I’ve spoken to the others and we’ve agreed that you can join us.
Excellent.
On two conditions. One — you give us your full co-operation.
It will be a pleasure.
And condition two?
That both of you do exactly as I say. Any disobedience and I’11l have you both tied up - and then you’d better just hope that we remember to untie you on our way out.
In that case... your word is our command.
Alright. In five minutes we’re gonna make an abseil descent of the northern shaft. Holly, if you could help us set up?
#225a: VORTEX ICE by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 13
Yes, boss!
FX: HOLLY AND SAI LEAVE.
(HUSHED) Alright, Doctor, what is it?
What’s what?
You’re not telling them something. Well, you can tell me.
The exotic particles are comprised of Artron energy.
Is that supposed to mean something?
Artron energy is usually only found within the brain of a Time Lord... or a TARDIS.
So this thing everyone’s looking for, is probably a Time Lord?
(APPREHENSIVE SIGH) Yes.
But that’s good news isn’t it? One of your people.
So one would hope, but I can think of several likely candidates with whom I have no great desire to be re-acquainted.
MUSIC LINK.
#225a: VORTEX ICE by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 14
SCENE 4. INT. LARGE CAVE.
FX: DEEP ECHO, DRIPPING WATER. ZIPPING SOUND OF ABSEILING
GADGET. FLIP IS DESCENDING FROM ABOVE US WITH A SUCCESSION OF JOLTS AND SWINGS AGAINST THE ROCK FACE, GETTING CLOSER.
(ABSEILING, LOVING IT) Woah! Coming down! Watch out below!
(CALLING UP TO HER) Use the brake bar! You’re going too fast!
(ABSEILING) I’1l be the judge of that, mate!
Doctor, is your... friend always so reckless?
Always. It’s one of her most likeable qualities. She reminds me of myself, when I was in my early five-hundreds.
Careful, you’re nearly there, three metres, two —
FX: FLIP LANDS NEATLY.
(LANDS) Woah! That was awesome. I get why you do this caving lark.
It’s no ‘lark’. (CALLS UP) Alright, Jannik, your turn!
FX: ABSEILING GADGET GOES ZIPPP! AS IT’S SENT BACK UP THE ROPE.
Blimey, it’s like a topical rainforest down here.
Yes, it must be nearly one-hundred percent humidity.
FX: JANNIK DESCENDING ON ROPE, RAPIDLY, SLIPPING.
(CALLS UP) Jannik, slow down! For heaven’s sake —
FX: JANNIK LANDS HEAVILY.
LANDS WITH THUD, OUCH
#225a: VORTEX ICE by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 15
Jannik, are you alright?
(GETS UP) The stupid descender didn’t grip. The rope’s soaking wet, was Slipping right through the bobbin.
Well, we’ll have to bear that in mind on the way back... Right, Holly, which way?
FX: HOLLY USES GADGET.
One of those two tunnels, that way or... that way. Oh no.
FX: GADGET OFF.
What is it?
One of the miners.
FX: THEY WALK ABOUT, JANNIK AND DYLAN MOVING AWAY.
(PERTURBED) There are more over there... A dozen at least.
Alright, Jannik, Holly, we were expecting this, we all knew what we were gonna find, so let’s keep it together.
(INTRIGUED RATHER THAN AFRAID) But they’re just... skeletons.
Well, it has been a hundred years.
Yeah, but they’re not buried. Which means they didn’t die ina rockfall.
And there’s air down here, so they didn’t asphyxiate. And they could gather condensation to drink; the tunnel walls down here are dripping wet.
So they starved to death?
#225a: VORTEX ICE by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 16
More likely the heat got them first.
Stuck down here, in the dark. I wonder if they thought they would be rescued, or whether they just gave up.
I told you to keep it together. (BEAT) Right, two tunnels - we split into two groups. Jannik, Dylan, you take that one. Holly, Doctor, Flip, with me.
Okay, boss.
Back here in fifteen minutes. And no disappearing acts. That’s
an order.
MUSIC LINK.
#225a: VORTEX ICE by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 17
SCENE 5. INT. CAVE (SPACESHIP).
FX: GROUP WALKING THROUGH NARROW TUNNEL, WATER DRIPPING.
This must’ve been one of the last tunnels to be excavated.
How can you possibly know that?
The salt seam has only been partially mined.
Maybe they gave up because of the heat.
(GOING AHEAD) Maybe...
Your friend seems right at home.
Yes, this is a normal day out for us. What about you? Spend a lot of time down abandoned mines?
Not really. I’ve spent the last ten years as a lab monkey at Caltech, then this job came up, and I put my name forward.
You volunteered?
If we do find something down here, this could be my big break. A new form of energy, alien artefacts. Hello!
FX: SHE BREAKS A LUMP OF ROCK OFF THE WALL.
What are you doing?
That’s blue halite. I told my daughter I’d bring her back a present.
FX: PUTS ROCK IN BACKPACK.
(KNOWS SOMETHING BAD WILL HAPPEN TO HOLLY) You have a daughter?
#225a: VORTEX ICE by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 18
Yes. Chloe. Two years old. It’s her birthday party next week, we delayed it until I could be there, when they’re that age they don’t notice. Sorry, are you alright?
(TRYING NOT TO BE VISIBLY UPSET) I’m fine, fine. She must be very proud of her mum, going off exploring.
I don’t think she really understands.
No, but she will —
FX: SHE IS CUT OFF BY HOLLY SEEING SOMETHING UP AHEAD.
Oh my — what is that?!?
FX: HOLLY RUNS. THEY EMERGE INTO ACOUSTICALLY LARGE CAVE.
Oh wow! Looks like a giant metal golf ball that’s been smashed to pieces.
Indeed. The miners must have uncovered it during their excavations.
FX: SAI PICKS UP OIL LAMP.
They abandoned their lamps. They must have left in a hurry.
But this.. is incredible. Fantastic. (FX: CAMERA) We have to record this. Every detail.
FX: SHE STARTS TAKING PHOTOS, MEASUREMENTS, READINGS.
I’ve never seen metal like that before, Doctor.
FX: DOCTOR USES HIS DETECTOR GIZMO.
Well, you wouldn’t have, because you’re looking at the remains of an alien spaceship. And I’1l tell you something else.
What?
#225a: VORTEX ICE by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 19
It’s not the source of the exotic particles.
#225a: VORTEX ICE by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 20
SCENE 6. INT. TUNNEL.
FX: JANNIK AND DYLAN IN ECHOEY TUNNEL.
This place is like a maze.
FX: JANNIK CHECKS IPAD GADGET.
None of this area is on the map, it must have been excavated before the disaster.
FX: GADGET OFF. DYLAN HALTS.
Looks like we’ve come to a dead end. In more ways than one.
Poor fellows, they must have been killed when the roof caved ih oles
No.
No?
FX: DYLAN PULLS AT ROCKS EXPERIMENTALLY.
These stones are loose. They could have dug themselves free.
Meaning?
Meaning they were dead before the roof caved in.
Well, there’s no way through... Maybe we should try one of these other tunnels.
Yeah, you’re right. No, wait. There’s something in there. (FX:
BOULDER OUT OF THE WAY) Look!
A light?! There’s light!?
#225a: VORTEX ICE by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 21
SCENE 7. INT. CAVE (SPACESHIP).
FX: HOLLY USING GADGET.
The Doctor’s right. This isn’t the source of the particles.
You mean, we’ve found an alien spacecraft by coincidence?
No, but you’re missing something very obvious.
What? That a hundred years ago, the miners dug up the remains of a spacecraft that had lain undisturbed for a million years?
Yeah, but look at it. It’s like an eggshell.
So?
So if you’re breaking into an egg, the bits go on the inside. These bits are on the outside.
Something broke out.
Yes. When they dug it up, there was something inside. Something that was very much alive!
We should get back to the northern shaft, Jannik and Dylan should be there by now.
But this is what we’ve -
You can talk all the photos you like later. Come on!
#225a: VORTEX ICE by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 22
SCENE 8. INT. TUNNEL.
FX: DYLAN SHIFTING ROCKS.
(HEAVING) One more.
We should go back.
Not yet. I’m nearly through. It would be quicker if you helped.
Alright, alright.
FX: TOGETHER THEY SHIFT ONE LAST ROCK.
WE HEAR QUIETLY AMBIENCE OF CRYSTAL CAVE (SEE NEXT SCENE).
There! Now will you look at that.
It’s like a.. a fairy grotto!
Those crystals. It’s like the Naica* cave, the size of Grand Central Station. One for the record books! (*PRONOUNCED NIGH- KA, RHYMES WITH ‘BIKER’ )
FX: THE OTHERS ARRIVE, SQUEEZING UNDER LOW CEILING.
What the hell’s going on, why didn’t you —
Dylan’s found us a cave.
(SQUEEZES PAST HIM) Selenite beams. It’s impressive, I'll give you that.
FX: DOCTOR TURNS UP, GIZMO ON THE GO.
And that’s not all.
It’s where those particles are coming from.
#225a: VORTEX ICE by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 23
What about the temperature?
(CHECKS) Forty degrees. We’1ll be alright so long as we don’t
stay in there too long.
Then let’s take a closer look, shall we?
MUSIC LINK.
#225a: VORTEX ICE by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 24
SCENE 9. INT. CRYSTAL CAVE.
FX: LARGE CAVE. B/G NOISE — ACOUSTICS HAVE STRANGE, SHIMMERY
ECHO, PLUS EVER-PRESENT PIXIE TINKLE. ALL MOVEMENTS SCRAPING AND SLIPPING OVER SMOOTH CRYSTALS, DISLODGING SMALL PEBBLES.
Watch your step, everyone. These crystals are like ice.
If only they were as cold as ice.
Doctor, the crystals are glowing.
Beautiful, isn’t it? Some quality of phosphorescence?
Or gamma radiation? Good point, Holly, can you —
FX: HOLLY CHECKS HER GADGET.
Already ahead of you. Radiation levels are above average, but within safety margins.
(IN DISTANCE) (CALLS OUT) Hey, I think we’ve found your source. Over here!
FX: THEY SCRABBLE OVER.
What is it?
Your guess is as good as mine.
Some kind of creature.. Trapped in the crystal, like a fly in amber.
Some fly! More like an octopus.
Or a robot. It’s made of the same metal as the spaceship.
Spaceship?
#225a: VORTEX ICE by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 25
This is its pilot. A cyborg. Half-organic, half-machine.
Have you seen anything like it before?
No. Not that I recall, and it would certainly stick in the mind. Seven legs, telescopic ommatophores and razor teeth.
Don’t touch it —
FX: DOCTOR TOUCHES CRYSTAL. SQUEAKS LIKE WIPING WET WINDOW.
It’s alright. The crystal is quite solid. If it is crystal.
What do you mean, ‘if’?
FX: DOCTOR USES GIZMO TO PERFORM SCAN. BLEEPS.
No. It’s ice.
Ice? In this heat?
Vortex ice. Crystalline stasis.
Doctor, nobody knows what you’re talking about.
Frozen chunks of time.
(INCREDULOUS LAUGH) Time?
Time. Solid time. Projections of four-dimensional space. Within the ice, the passage of time is brought to a standstill.
Like cryogenics?
Broadly speaking, yes, but more accurately speaking, no.
#225a: VORTEX ICE by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 26
And this thing is giving off the particles?
No, no... But it’s somewhere in here.
Okay, Dylan, with me. Holly, Jannik, you go with them.
I’d like to examine the specimen, if I may. It is alien life.
Alright. But everyone. Stay within sight and the moment I say we leave, we leave. The clock is ticking.
MUSIC LINK.
#225a: VORTEX ICE by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 27
SCENE 10. INT. CRYSTAL CAVE.
FX: DYLAN AND SAI SCRABBLING OVER ROCK.
Well, Jannik?
A dead end. Another rockfall. I don’t think there’s any way through.
But there was a way through before? A second cave?
There might be, but we’d have to cut through the crystals —
If that’s even possible.
You don’t actually believe the Doctor? Frozen time?

In the last hour, I’ve met two people wandering around a tunnel that’s taken us two days to reach, I’ve seen a cave of giant crystals, the remains of an alien spaceship and its pilot. Right now, I'll believe anything.
Well, believe me when I say that if we stay here much longer we run a serious risk of heatstroke.
Point taken. Let’s find the others.
#225a: VORTEX ICE by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 28
SCENE 11. INT. CRYSTAL CAVE.
FX: DOCTOR, FLIP, HOLLY CLAMBERING. DOCTOR’S GIZMO HOMING IN.
This way. Getting very close. Five metres. Four metres. Three —
FX: GIZMO WHOOPS, DOCTOR SWITCHES IT OFF.
Oh my.
Well, you did say you thought it might be a Time Lord.
Yes, but not that one. Not him!
What are you talking about — (REACTS) What on Earth. But... but that’s you!
Yes.
You, in the crystal.
In, aS you so accurately observe, the crystal.
What is this, some sort of joke?
No joke. And it’s not just me. Look.
Oh no. That’s me!
I’m sorry.
But, that’s me, frozen in the... thing. Me as I am now. She’s even wearing the same clothes!
Yes. (FX: WIPES CRYSTAL WITH SLEEVE) The inimitable Philippa Jackson.
#225a: VORTEX ICE by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 29
What are they, copies?
No. They’re us. Or rather, they will be.
What?
They are our future selves. At some point in our personal timelines, Flip and I will end up entombed in vortex ice.
NOTE: THE DOCTOR IS WRONG HERE
How can you be so sure?
Well, do you remember being trapped in this ice?
(CAUTIOUSLY) No, but...
Then it must be something that hasn’t happened yet, mustn’t it?
Yeah, but how can you be sure it will happen?
Because we have found ourselves in the ice. Therefore it has happened, therefore it will happen, therefore it must happen.
(NOTE: FLIP HAS A PERSONAL INTEREST IN THIS DISCUSSION ABOUT
THEY CAN CHANGE ESTABLISHED EVENTS, SHE’S NOT JUST
QUESTIONS FOR THE SAKE OF IT.)
‘Must’? Don’t we get any choice in the matter?
This is our destiny. It has now been written. If we try to avoid our fate, the resulting paradox would be calamitous.
Yeah, but actually, though, would anyone care?
I’d care, and so would half this galaxy when the other half suddenly went missing.
#225a: VORTEX ICE by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 30
Alright then. Say these are our ‘future selves’. Are they dead?
No. No, I don’t think so. Merely frozen in an instant.
Then we have to get them out. Because I don’t know about you, but I don’t much fancy being stuck in a block of ice for all eternity!
FX: THE OTHERS ARRIVE.
Alright, time to leave. One hour cool down, then you can come back and — what? What is it?
We found our source.
(SEES DOCTOR AND FLIP IN ICE) I see. Well, that makes about as much sense as anything else around here. Okay, you two, you’ve got some explaining to do.
FADE OUT.
#225a: VORTEX ICE by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 31
SCENE 12. INT. CAVE (SPACESHIP).
FX: THEY’VE SET UP SOME ELECTRIC FANS TO COOL THEM DOWN.
IS DRINKING WATER/MOPPING BROWS DURING SCENE.
You’re time travellers?
Yes. Our vehicle is not far from where you found us.
We’d only just arrived, you see.
So where are you from, originally?
Well, originally, Thamesmead, East London. It’s near Woolwich.
And I’m from Gallifrey, constellation of Kasterborous. It’s just to the left of Karn, you can’t miss it.
You’re an alien from another planet?
Very much so.
So the exotic particles we’ve been looking for, they’re coming
from you? I mean, future you?
Yes. It’s a form of Time Lord distress call.
Which we picked up and answered. Does that even make sense?
It does raise some fascinating ontological issues, regarding the nature of cause and effect —
FX: SUDDEN CLATTER, FAN KNOCKED OVER, MAKES SINISTER NOISE.
What the —
FX: FAN IS RIGHTED, BACK TO NORMAL.
#225a: VORTEX ICE by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 32
Sorry, that was me, was just getting water and tripped over one of the fans.
Try not to get yourself killed if you can help it. Alright, Doctor, what do you know about the other thing, the cyborg?

I’m afraid I can’t help you. I’ve never seen it before. This is all in my future, you see. Evidently, my friend and I will come to this mine a hundred years ago, and end up entombed, but beyond that, I’m afraid your guess is as good as mine.
Can we get them out of the ice, your future selves?
I’ve been wondering about that. If we caused the temporal field to collapse, it should be possible.
And can you do that, that thing you just said?
With the Professor’s permission...?
Just do it. Okay, break over, we can — wait. Where’s Holly?
She was here.
And the girl, Flip? Where is she?
#225a: VORTEX ICE by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 33
SCENE 13. INT. CRYSTAL CAVE.
FX: FLIP AND HOLLY CLAMBERING OVER ICE.
Flip. What are you doing?
I just wanted to take another look.
At yourself?
